title: Training
description: Requirements for food safety and hygiene training programs including new and existing worker training, sanitation worker training, illness reporting procedures, and non-conformance documentation

requirements.text: Is there a food safety hygiene training program covering new and existing workers and are there records of these training events?
mandatoryStatements: Food safety hygiene training program is documented
Program covers both new hires and existing workers
Training includes food safety and personal hygiene practices
Initial training provided before workers begin food handling
Refresher training provided at least annually
Training records document attendees, date, topics, and trainer
Training effectiveness is evaluated
Training content is appropriate for worker roles and risks
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that all workers have current training, annual review of training program content
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly review of training records, immediate training for new hires before starting work

requirements.text: Is there a documented training program with training logs for the sanitation workers, including best practices and chemical use details?
mandatoryStatements: Documented training program exists specifically for sanitation workers
Training covers cleaning and sanitizing best practices
Training includes proper chemical handling and use
Training covers concentration testing and verification
Training addresses safety precautions for chemical use
Training logs document sanitation worker training completion
Retraining provided when procedures change or performance issues identified
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that sanitation workers have current specialized training
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Initial training before assignment to sanitation duties, annual refresher training minimum

requirements.text: Are there written and communicated procedures in place that require food handlers to report any cuts or grazes and/or if they are suffering any illnesses that might be a contamination risk to the products being produced, and return to work requirements? (In countries with health privacy/confidentiality laws, e.g., USA, auditors can check procedure/policy but not the actual records).
mandatoryStatements: Written procedure requires reporting of cuts, grazes, and wounds
Written procedure requires reporting of illnesses that could contaminate product
Procedure identifies reportable illnesses (vomiting, diarrhea, jaundice, fever, sore throat)
Procedure defines return to work requirements after illness
Procedure is communicated to all food handlers
Procedure complies with health privacy laws where applicable
Management response procedure for reported illnesses/injuries is defined
Procedure includes work restrictions for ill or injured workers
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of illness reporting procedure, quarterly verification that procedure is communicated
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing monitoring that workers understand and follow reporting requirements

requirements.text: Are there worker food safety non-conformance records and associated corrective actions (including retraining records)?
mandatoryStatements: Records are maintained for worker food safety non-conformances
Records document nature of non-conformance
Records show corrective actions taken
Corrective actions include retraining where appropriate
Retraining is documented with date and topics covered
Repeat violations are escalated appropriately
Records demonstrate that non-conformances are addressed effectively
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of non-conformance records and corrective action effectiveness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation of non-conformances, corrective action within 24-48 hours

capaInject: If food safety training program not established: develop program within 14 days, train all personnel within 30 days
If workers lack current training: immediate training scheduling, completion within 14 days, remove from food handling until trained
If sanitation worker training inadequate: immediate specialized training, verify competency before assigning sanitation duties
If illness reporting procedure not documented or communicated: document procedure within 7 days, communicate to all workers immediately
If non-conformances not documented or not addressed: immediate documentation system implementation, address all current issues within 7 days
traceabilityInject: Training records must be traceable to specific employees, dates, topics, and trainers
Non-conformance records must be traceable to specific workers, incidents, and corrective actions
Retraining records must be traceable to specific non-conformances or procedure changes
Illness reports must be documented in compliance with privacy laws while maintaining food safety controls
